entries.title: Ten Years Into the Fight for $15, Workers Are Still Fighting for a Living Wage
entries.description:
In Part 2 of “Insecurity,” we meet Eshawney Gaston, a fast-food worker who joins the wave of labor uprisings sweeping the country during the pandemic.

The post Ten Years Into the Fight for $15, Workers Are Still Fighting for a Living Wage appeared first on The Intercept.

entries.title: Introducing "Insecurity"
entries.description:
Introducing "Insecurity," a video triptych of stories about women struggling for what they need after the pandemic upends their lives: social services, a living wage, or decent mental health care.

The post Introducing “Insecurity” appeared first on The Intercept.
